item.title: What did i do wrong on this?
item.dc:creator: @Nets8 Nets8
item.description:
@Nets8 wrote:

Wrong Statement

[code]{ else if (heightLevel = 1);

                                    heightLevel -= 1;
				teleportToX = 2417;
				teleportToY = 3077;
			}[/code]

Right Statement

else if (heightLevel == 1) { --heightLevel; teleportToX = 2417; teleportToY = 3077; }

Use == for comparing and = for defining and declaring. Don’t put a ; after an if or else if statement. Put a { after the else if or if statement, not before it. Using --heightLevel; instead of heightLevel -= 1; is not needed but saves space and is good to use as a regular Java convention.

Read full topic
item.source: What did i do wrong on this?

item.title: What did i do wrong on this?
item.dc:creator: @scottbenton scottbenton
item.description:
@scottbenton wrote:

[code=java]case 4419:

                            if (objectX == 2417 && objectY == 3074)                                
			{	heightLevel += 0;
				teleportToX = 2417;
				teleportToY = 3074;
			}
			{	else if (heightLevel = 1);
			
                                    heightLevel -= 1;
				teleportToX = 2417;
				teleportToY = 3077;
			}

                            break;[/code]

what did i do wrong becuz in compiler it says i need boolean well i tried creating a public boolean and got 100 errors any help please?
